destination_info.name: China Multi-City Journey: Chongqing, Bazhong, Chengdu, Shanghai, Beijing
destination_info.best_time_to_visit: February-March 2026 is winter/early spring in China - cold but fewer tourists outside Chinese New Year period. Chinese New Year 2026 falls on February 17th with 9-day public holiday from Feb 15-23, bringing massive crowds and higher prices during this period.
destination_info.weather: Chongqing 8-12°C humid and foggy, Bazhong 5-10°C cold, Chengdu 8-14°C mild, Shanghai 5-12°C chilly, Beijing -2 to 8°C dry cold. Pack warm layers, especially for Beijing.
destination_info.time_zone: China Standard Time (UTC+8) - entire country uses single time zone
destination_info.currency: Chinese Yuan (CNY/RMB). Current rate approximately 1 EUR = 7.8 RMB. Digital payments (Alipay, WeChat Pay) dominate; cash rarely needed.
destination_info.language: Mandarin Chinese. Limited English in tourist areas. Translation apps essential. Chongqing/Bazhong/Chengdu speak Sichuan dialect, Shanghai has local dialect, Beijing speaks standard Mandarin.
destination_info.overview: Ambitious 21-day journey through five distinct Chinese cities showcasing China's diversity: mountain megacity Chongqing with hotpot culture, hometown Bazhong for authentic Spring Festival celebrations, panda capital Chengdu blending tradition and modernity, cosmopolitan Shanghai as China's financial hub, and imperial capital Beijing rich in history. Trip spans Chinese New Year period, offering unique cultural immersion but requiring careful planning around crowds and closures.

attractions.name: CHONGQING: Pipa Yuan Hotpot Restaurant on Nanshan Mountain
attractions.description: World's largest hotpot restaurant covering entire hillside with 888 tables seating 5,851 guests. Guinness World Record holder with spectacular night views of Chongqing cityscape. Red lanterns and light installations create magical atmosphere after sunset.
attractions.location: Nanshan Mountain Hotpot Street, Nan'an District, Chongqing

attractions.name: CHONGQING: Eling Park Second Factory (二厂)
attractions.description: Former factory transformed into trendy cultural creative park with retro aesthetics, art galleries, cafes, and bookstores. Instagram-worthy hidden gem beloved by locals. Featured in popular Chinese film 'The Last Night'.
attractions.location: Eling Park area, Yuzhong District

attractions.name: CHONGQING: Zhongshuge Bookstore
attractions.description: One of China's most beautiful bookstores with mirror-ceiling design creating infinite library illusion. Quiet, contemplative space perfect for INFJ personalities. Architectural photography hotspot.
attractions.location: Chongqing Zhongshuge, Yuzhong District

attractions.name: CHENGDU: Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding
attractions.description: World-renowned panda conservation center with 200+ giant pandas. See pandas most active 7:30-10am during feeding time. February's cool weather means pandas stay outdoors longer and are more playful.
attractions.location: 1375 Panda Avenue, Chenghua District, Chengdu
attractions.best_time: 7:30-10am peak activity; West Gate entrance better for 9am arrival

attractions.name: CHENGDU: Jinli Ancient Street
attractions.description: 550-meter historic street recreating Three Kingdoms period atmosphere. CNN named it one of 21 most beautiful streets worldwide. Famous for Sichuan snacks, tea houses, traditional crafts. Most magical at evening when red lanterns illuminate (6-7:30pm). Note: Some 2025 reviews criticize over-commercialization.
attractions.location: East of Wuhou Temple, Wuhou District

attractions.name: CHENGDU: Kuanzhai Alley (Wide and Narrow Alley)
attractions.description: Three parallel Qing Dynasty alleys (Kuan Alley, Zhai Alley, Jing Alley) showcasing old Chengdu courtyard architecture. Mix of traditional tea houses, trendy bars, boutiques. Metro Line 4 access. Warning: highly commercialized like Jinli.
attractions.location: Qingyang District, near Renmin Park

attractions.name: CHENGDU: Taikoo Li Chengdu
attractions.description: Upscale open-air shopping complex blending modern architecture with traditional Sichuan style. Features international luxury brands, trendy cafes, the famous Climbing Panda sculpture at nearby IFS. Fashion-forward alternative to historical sites.
attractions.location: No.8 Zhongsha Mao Street, Jinjiang District, next to Chunxi Road

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: The Bund (Waitan)
attractions.description: Shanghai's iconic 1.5km waterfront promenade showcasing 52 historical European-style buildings from 1920s-30s facing futuristic Pudong skyline across Huangpu River. UNESCO World Heritage atmosphere. Best views from Waibaidu Bridge. Walk takes 30-45 minutes leisurely, up to 2 hours with photography stops.
attractions.location: Zhongshan East Road, Huangpu District (Metro Line 2/10 East Nanjing Road Station)
attractions.best_time: Evening for skyline lights, or early morning to avoid crowds

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: Nanjing Road Pedestrian Street
attractions.description: China's premier 5.5km shopping street from The Bund to Jing'an Temple. Over 600 stores including Tiffany, Mont Blanc, Omega. West Nanjing Road has 1,200+ high-end brands with 80% of world's top luxury labels. 10-15 minute walk to The Bund.
attractions.location: Nanjing Road, Huangpu/Jing'an Districts

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: People's Square
attractions.description: Central public square surrounded by Shanghai Museum, Shanghai Grand Theatre, and City Hall. Major metro hub (Lines 1, 2, 8). Good starting point for walking to Nanjing Road and The Bund. Note: Shanghai Museum People's Square branch has scaled back exhibits; main collections moved to new East Building in Pudong.
attractions.location: Huangpu District (Metro Lines 1, 2, 8 People's Square Station)
attractions.estimated_cost: Free for square; museum free with reservation

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: iRen Study (INFJ Bookstore)
attractions.description: Tiny 14 sqm 24-hour unattended bookstore along Suzhou Creek designed specifically for introverts. Named after MBTI personality type 'iRen' (introverted people in Chinese). Quiet refuge with English books including '100 Ways to Happiness'. Perfect INFJ-friendly spot.
attractions.location: Along Suzhou Creek, Shanghai

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: 1984 Bookstore
attractions.description: Quiet vintage cafe near Shanghai Library Metro with jazz music, cozy garden seating. Staff speaks excellent English. Perfect for reading and quiet conversation. Beloved by expats and book lovers. Ideal INFJ retreat.
attractions.location: Near Shanghai Library Metro Station

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: Pop Mart Flagship Store Xintiandi
attractions.description: 500+ sqm two-floor flagship store designed like futuristic spaceship with 10 themed rooms. Headquarters of blind box culture featuring Labubu, Sonny Angel, exclusive Shanghai Skyline Edition figures. Must-visit for toy collectors. Note: Sonny Angel made by Japanese Dreams Inc., separate from Pop Mart but sold there.
attractions.location: Xintiandi, Huangpu District
attractions.estimated_cost: 50-500+ RMB depending on purchases (blind boxes 59-79 RMB each)

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: Huaihai Road Middle
attractions.description: Shanghai's most stylish shopping street emphasizing fashion, art, and lifestyle. More curated and taste-focused than Nanjing Road. Features creative lifestyle stores, art-filled malls like iapm, K11. Recently added Musinsa Standard (Korean fashion platform) and 125+ new first stores in 2024-2025. Where Shanghainese shop for fashion.
attractions.location: Huaihai Middle Road, Luwan/Huangpu Districts

attractions.name: SHANGHAI: Shanghai Disneyland
attractions.description: China's first Disney park with unique attractions like TRON Lightcycle, Zootopia land, largest Enchanted Storybook Castle. February 2026 crucial timing: AVOID Chinese New Year week (Feb 15-23) when it's packed; mid-late February after holiday has low crowds. TRON and Zootopia have 60+ min waits 10am-8pm even on slow days - ride at opening. Average wait 27-31 minutes. Tickets ~500-700 RMB per person in winter.
attractions.location: Pudong District (Metro Line 11 Disney Resort Station, 45 min from People's Square)
attractions.estimated_cost: 500-700 RMB per person entrance; 200-400 RMB food/souvenirs
attractions.best_time: Weekdays outside Chinese New Year, arrive at opening 9am for popular rides

attractions.name: BEIJING: Forbidden City (Palace Museum)
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, world's largest imperial palace complex with 980 buildings. 2026 update: Tickets released 7 days advance, sell out instantly during peak season; book IMMEDIATELY when available. Entrance: Meridian Gate (Wu Men) only. Temporarily closed Aug 31-Sep 4, 2025 for ceremonies. Central Axis quick route (2-3 hrs) or comprehensive route (4-5 hrs). Don't miss Treasure Gallery and Clock Gallery (separate 10 RMB tickets). Exit north to Jingshan Park for panoramic Forbidden City views.
attractions.location: 4 Jingshan Front St, Dongcheng District (Metro Line 1 Tiananmen East/West)
attractions.estimated_cost: 60 RMB entrance + 20 RMB for both galleries
attractions.best_time: Arrive 8:30am opening; weekdays Nov-March; avoid holidays

attractions.name: BEIJING: Jingshan Park
attractions.description: Hilltop park directly north of Forbidden City offering best panoramic views of entire palace complex from Wanchun Pavilion. Especially stunning at sunrise/sunset. Former imperial garden. Short climb to viewpoint.
attractions.location: Jingshan Front St, Dongcheng District (north exit of Forbidden City)
attractions.best_time: Morning or sunset after Forbidden City visit

attractions.name: BEIJING: Nanluoguxiang Hutong
attractions.description: 800-year-old 1km alley in Dongcheng District lined with cafes, bars, boutiques, traditional crafts. Beijing's third most popular bar street after Sanlitun and Houhai. Hutong atmosphere with modern amenities. Nearby hidden gem bars: Caterpillar Bar (Jiaodaokou South St), Libertango (Fangjia Hutong), Modernista (Baochao Hutong). Cafes: Still Water Coffee with courtyard and terrace, Three Trees Coffee, Voyage Coffee in century-old courtyard.
attractions.location: Dongcheng District (Metro Line 6/8 Nanluoguxiang Station)

attractions.name: BEIJING: 798 Art District
attractions.description: Former military factory complex transformed into avant-garde contemporary art hub with 200+ galleries, street art, sculptures, cafes, boutiques. Vast open-air museum across 19 low-density buildings. 80+ exhibitions monthly, served 12 million visitors in 2024. Plan minimum 5 hours - huge area with much to explore. Wear comfortable shoes. Many galleries charge admission.
attractions.location: 2 Jiuxianqiao Road, Chaoyang District (Metro Line 14 Wangjing Nan Station exit B1, 20 min walk)
attractions.estimated_cost: Free outdoor areas; gallery admissions 20-100 RMB each; 100-200 RMB food
attractions.best_time: Weekdays to avoid crowds; galleries closed Mondays

attractions.name: BEIJING: Sanlitun & Taikoo Li
attractions.description: Beijing's fashion and nightlife epicenter with flagship stores (Adidas, Apple, Uniqlo, Nike, Mango, Puma), open-air shopping district with 19 contemporary buildings, 80+ bars. Fashion, food, art, and culture hub. Perfect for couples shopping and evening entertainment. Compare to Shanghai's Taikoo Li but with Beijing nightlife edge.
attractions.location: Chaoyang District (Metro Line 10 Tuanjiehu Station, 10 min walk)

attractions.name: BEIJING: Xidan Shopping District
attractions.description: Youth fashion paradise in Xicheng District. Xidan Joy City is 13-story complex with world's longest escalator, China's largest digital cinema, Beijing's largest cosmetic shop. Features SALOMON outdoor gear, Jellycat plush toys, H&M, Zara. Younger, trendier vibe than Sanlitun. Metro accessible.
attractions.location: Xicheng District (Metro Line 1/4 Xidan Station)

attractions.name: BEIJING: Tianjin Day Trip (Optional)
attractions.description: Former foreign concession port city 35-40 minutes from Beijing by bullet train. Famous for Five Great Avenues (Wudadao) European architecture, Jing Garden (last emperor's home), Italian Style Street, Ancient Culture Street, Ceramic House. Easy day trip if have free time. Trains depart Beijing South Railway Station (Metro Lines 4/14) frequently.
attractions.location: Tianjin City (35-40 min bullet train from Beijing South Station)

attractions.name: BEIJING: Only This Green (只此青绿) Dance Drama
attractions.description: Acclaimed poetic dance drama inspired by Northern Song Dynasty masterpiece 'A Thousand Miles of Rivers and Mountains' by painter Wang Ximeng. Performed by China Oriental Song and Dance Troupe, premiered at National Centre for Performing Arts. 9.7 Damai rating. Over 650 performances across China/internationally. Stunning visual feast combining traditional culture with modern dance. Perfect evening activity Feb 22 after arrival.
attractions.location: National Centre for Performing Arts or Beijing Poly Theater (check schedule)

accommodations.name: Raffles Intercontinental Hotel Chongqing (Pre-booked)
accommodations.location: Yuzhong District, Chongqing (near Chaotianmen, Raffles City complex)
accommodations.description: Luxury 5-star hotel in Raffles City complex near Chaotianmen metro station. Pre-booked for Feb 15 arrival. Excellent location for exploring Jiefangbei Pedestrian Street. Offers airport transfer service - call ahead to confirm.

accommodations.name: Family Home - Bazhong (Pre-arranged)
accommodations.location: 半山逸城A区35幢1902, Bazhong, Sichuan
accommodations.description: Staying with family for Spring Festival celebrations Feb 16-17. Authentic hometown experience during Chinese New Year.

accommodations.name: SK简奢·逅熙酒店 Nanjing Road Shanghai (Pre-booked)
accommodations.description: Pre-booked for Shanghai stay Feb 18-22. Excellent central location near Nanjing Road shopping, 10-15 min walk to The Bund, direct metro access. Budget positioning.

accommodations.name: Orange Hotel (桔子酒店) Beijing
accommodations.location: Various locations in Dongcheng or Chaoyang Districts, Beijing
accommodations.description: Mid-range Chinese hotel chain with modern design, clean rooms, good value. Suitable for 1-night Feb 22 hotel stay before moving to rental apartment. Consider locations near metro Line 1/2 for accessibility to main sights.

accommodations.name: Beijing Serviced Apartments - Dongcheng District
accommodations.location: Dongcheng District, Beijing (near Wangfujing or Nanluoguxiang areas)
accommodations.description: Rental apartment for extended Beijing stay Feb 23-Mar 7 (13 nights). Dongcheng District offers proximity to Forbidden City, Nanluoguxiang, Wangfujing. Options include Lee Garden Service Apartment, The Base-Beijing Wangfujing, Beijing New World Centre Aparthotel with amenities like kitchenettes, laundry, living space. Cost-effective for long stays. Budget approximately 200-400 RMB/night for 13 nights = 2600-5200 RMB total.

restaurants.name: CHONGQING: Pipa Yuan Hotpot (枇杷园火锅)
restaurants.description: World's largest hotpot restaurant on Nanshan Mountain with 888 tables, Guinness World Record holder. Spectacular hillside setting with red lanterns and night views of Chongqing skyline. Authentic spicy Chongqing hotpot experience. Must-visit for Feb 15 evening dinner with night view.

restaurants.name: BAZHONG: Laoqi Beef (老七牛肉)
restaurants.description: Local Bazhong restaurant famous for beef dishes. Traditional Sichuan preparation. Hometown favorite.
restaurants.location: Bazhong City, Sichuan (specific location to be confirmed locally)

restaurants.name: BAZHONG: Laowu Sauce Pork Buns (老五酱肉包子)
restaurants.description: Popular local breakfast spot famous for sauce pork buns (baozi). Must-try Bazhong street food. Perfect for morning before train to Chengdu Feb 17.
restaurants.location: Bazhong City, Sichuan (specific location to be confirmed locally)

restaurants.name: CHENGDU: Mingting Restaurant (明婷饭店)
restaurants.description: Local Chengdu restaurant. Rated 3.7/5 on TripAdvisor. Authentic Sichuan flavors.

restaurants.name: CHENGDU: Taolin Restaurant (饕林)
restaurants.description: Popular Chengdu restaurant rated 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor. Known for delicious traditional Sichuan stir-fried dishes and local specialties. Multiple locations including Chunxi Road branch.
restaurants.location: Chunxi Road and other locations, Chengdu

restaurants.name: CHENGDU: Niuchengcheng Japanese Beef Buffet (牛丞丞)
restaurants.description: Japanese-style beef buffet in Chengdu. All-you-can-eat format featuring various beef cuts and Japanese preparations. Popular with locals.

restaurants.name: SHANGHAI: Ren He Guan - Xuhui (人和馆)
restaurants.description: One Star Michelin restaurant in 2024-2025 Shanghai Guide. Excellent Shanghainese restaurant famous for Hong Shao Rou (red braised pork). Average 250 RMB per person. Reservation recommended. Must-try on Feb 19.

restaurants.name: SHANGHAI: Yakiniku Ajiya Japanese BBQ
restaurants.description: Popular Japanese BBQ restaurant at 1333 Huaihai Zhong Lu, 4th floor. Not Michelin-starred but highly regarded. Originated from Tokyo (Ajikura in Shibuya). Wallet-friendly with plentiful marbled beef, chicken, pork selections. Popular among Japanese expats. Good for Feb 19 dinner.
restaurants.location: 4/F, 1333 Huaihai Zhong Lu, near Baoqing Lu, Shanghai

restaurants.name: BEIJING: Dadong Roast Duck (大董)
restaurants.description: Michelin-starred upscale roast duck restaurant using 22-day ducks for tender meat. New-style duck that's crispy but not greasy. Beautiful presentation. Higher price point but consistently praised quality. Reddit 2026 consensus: Better than Quanjude. Reservation essential.
restaurants.location: Multiple Beijing locations including Nanxincang, Tuanjiehu (near Sanlitun)

restaurants.name: BEIJING: Siji Minfu (四季民福)
restaurants.description: 2026 crowd favorite for Peking duck, preferred by expats and locals over Quanjude and even Dadong for value and quality. Expanding internationally. Consistently excellent. More affordable than Dadong while maintaining high quality. Multiple locations. Easier to get table than Michelin places. Highly recommended.
restaurants.location: Multiple Beijing locations including near Forbidden City

Could be interesting INFJ-friendly alternative to typical cafes for Feb 19, though more shopping-oriented than quiet retreat.

transportation.getting_there: International: Paris CDG to Chongqing Jiangbei Airport (CKG) - Pre-booked HU718 landing 4:40am Feb 15. Domestic connections: Chongqing to Bazhong high-speed train (~150 RMB, book 30 days advance via 12306.cn English site), Bazhong to Chengdu high-speed train (~100 RMB, 1-2 hours), Chengdu Shuangliu to Shanghai Pudong CA4509 14:35-17:20 (pre-booked), Beijing Daxing departure Mar 7.
transportation.airport: Chongqing Jiangbei (CKG) - arrival airport, 25km to Raffles Hotel. Shanghai Pudong (PVG) - domestic arrival from Chengdu. Beijing Daxing (PKX) - departure airport with 2026 extension to Lize Business District station (Lines 11/14/16/Fangshan Line transfers), 22-minute express to Caoqiao Station (35 RMB standard/50 RMB business class), or 20-minute Jingxiong Intercity Railway to Beijing West (30 RMB).
local_transport: Metro (all 5 cities have extensive systems - buy city metro cards, Beijing/Shanghai/Chengdu especially comprehensive)
Didi ride-hailing (download app, use Alipay mini-app version for easy payment, English support available)
Taxis (use Didi for easier booking, cash/Alipay payment)
Walking (Shanghai Bund to Nanjing Road 10-15 min, Beijing hutong areas walkable)
transportation.transport_tips: ESSENTIAL APPS: Download before arrival - Alipay (primary for payments, Didi, metro), WeChat Pay (backup payment), Didi (taxis - or use Alipay mini-app), Gaode Maps (navigation - better than Google in China), 12306 app (train tickets - or use English website). VPN recommended for Google Maps backup. Alipay Tour Pass allows international credit card link without Chinese bank account - set up before flying. Metro cards: Beijing/Shanghai use rechargeable transit cards (deposit refundable). High-speed trains: Book 15-30 days advance on 12306.cn English site, passport required for registration. Chongqing Jiangbei Airport to Raffles: Taxi 25km ~55 RMB (30-40 min) OR Metro Line 10 to Hongtudi, transfer Line 6 to Xiaoshizi, 16 min walk to hotel (cheapest) OR Airport Bus K01 to Jiefangbei ~60 min. China 30-day visa-free policy extended until Dec 31, 2026 for eligible nationalities.
transportation.estimated_transport_cost: Daily metro/taxi 50-100 RMB per person (metro 3-10 RMB per ride, taxis 15-50 RMB per ride, Didi similar). High-speed trains: Chongqing-Bazhong ~150 RMB, Bazhong-Chengdu ~100 RMB. Domestic flight Chengdu-Shanghai pre-booked. Beijing metro 3-10 RMB per ride. Daxing Airport Express 35 RMB. Total estimated transport for 21 days: ~2000 RMB for 2 people (metro passes, trains, taxis, airport transfers).

estimated_costs.accommodation_total: Chongqing: Raffles pre-booked. Bazhong: Free (family). Shanghai: SK Hotel pre-booked. Beijing: Orange Hotel 1 night ~300 RMB + Rental apartment 13 nights × 300 RMB avg = 4,200 RMB total Beijing. Total accommodations ~4,500 RMB for 2 people.
estimated_costs.food_daily: Average 150-250 RMB per person per day. 21 days × 200 RMB avg × 2 people = 8,400 RMB. With family meals in Bazhong and apartment cooking in Beijing, realistic: 6,000-7,000 RMB food total.
estimated_costs.activities_total: Shanghai Disneyland 1,200 RMB (2 people). Forbidden City + galleries 160 RMB. 798 galleries 200-400 RMB. Panda Base 110 RMB. Massage/spa 500-1,500 RMB. Only This Green show 600-1,600 RMB. Couple photography 2,388-3,000 RMB. Total activities: ~7,000 RMB.
estimated_costs.transportation_total: High-speed trains 500 RMB. Daily metro/taxis 1,600 RMB. Airport transfers 185 RMB. Total transport: ~2,500 RMB for 2 people.
estimated_costs.total_estimate: Accommodation 4,500 + Food 6,500 + Activities 7,000 + Transport 2,500 = 20,500 RMB total for 2 people = 10,250 RMB per person. With savings (family stays, apartment cooking, careful spending): Achievable at 7,500-8,000 RMB per person (within 1,000 EUR/7,800 RMB budget per person).
estimated_costs.currency: Chinese Yuan (CNY/RMB). Exchange rate Feb-Mar 2026: approximately 1 EUR = 7.8 RMB.
estimated_costs.notes: Budget is TIGHT but ACHIEVABLE with careful spending. Family accommodations in Bazhong save significantly. Beijing apartment with kitchen allows meal preparation reducing food costs 30-40%. Mix budget/mid-range/splurge meals. Don't skip: Disneyland, couple photography, quality Beijing duck dinner, Panda Base. Can skip/reduce: luxury spa, extensive shopping, paid galleries. Recommend bringing extra 200-300 EUR buffer for unexpected expenses.

practical_info.visa_requirements: China's 30-day visa-free policy extended until December 31, 2026 for eligible EU nationals. Feb 15 - Mar 7 = 21 days (within 30-day limit). No visa needed if eligible. Bring passport with 6+ months validity.
practical_info.health_safety: February = cold/flu season. Bring warm clothing, face masks (air quality variable), hand sanitizer, medications. Tap water NOT drinkable - buy bottled. Pharmacies widely available. Travel insurance ESSENTIAL.
practical_info.local_customs: Spring Festival period (Feb 15-23): Most important holiday. Respect family time. Red envelopes gifts if given by elders. Tipping NOT expected. Moderate PDA okay. Remove shoes in homes. Gift giving: bring small gift from France if visiting family. Avoid: clocks, white flowers, sharp objects as gifts.
practical_info.emergency_numbers: Police 110, Ambulance 120, Fire 119, Tourist hotline 12301. French Embassy Beijing +86 10 8531 2000, French Consulate Shanghai +86 21 6103 2200.
